comments:
There is a scenario which results in an ignore folder not being properly 
ignored. Here it is:

1) Create a project with a bin folder and release the bin folder.
2) Realize that you want bin ignored so add it to the .cvsignore file and 
delete it from the repository
3) Replace the local project using either Replace with latest or Checkout.
4) The bin folder appears an an outgoing questionable addition

The reason this occurs is because the project still thinks it is managing the 
bin folder (i.e. the folder isManaged() but is not a CVS folder). The 
workaround is to delete the local project and re-checkout.

Here are the options:
1) State that deleting a folder remotely requires all users to delete their 
projects and re-checkout. This is probbaly an acceptable solution as deleting 
folders remotely is frowned upon.
2) On checkout, purge the sync info as well as the projetc contents. This is 
probably a good thing to do and wouldn't require the user to delete in option 1.
3) Have the replace with detect the deleted directory and adjust the sync info 
properly. This is also doable but is a little more work.

The above situation results in the following NPE when you try to look at the 
CVS properties of the bin folder:

This bug has not been touched for 2 years. Closing as WONTFIX. Please reopen if 
you feel this is still an important issue.
